intro: Hieracium nautanense, commonly known as sea hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to coastal areas of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in saline or coastal environments, showing adaptations to withstand salt spray and sandy soils. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium nautanense is often found in dunes and rocky shores, playing a role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
